title: Sources: Buss family to sell Lakers, valued at $10B
content: The Buss family is entering into an agreement to sell majority ownership of the Lakers to Mark Walter, who also owns the Dodgers, for a franchise valuation of approximately $10 billion, sources told ESPN.

title: Browns rookie Sanders cited for driving 101 mph
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders was cited by police early Tuesday morning for driving 101 mph in a 60 mph zone, according to police records.

title: Sources: Draft prospect Bailey cancels 76ers visit
content: Former Rutgers star Ace Bailey has canceled a visit to the Philadelphia 76ers, sources told ESPN, and has yet to visit any NBA teams ahead of next week's NBA draft.

title: Rays' 8-run comeback largest in MLB this season
content: The Rays overcame an eight-run deficit to beat the Orioles 12-8 on Wednesday night in the largest comeback in the majors this season, which also matched Tampa Bay's biggest comeback in franchise history.

title: Yanks finally score, otherwise sputter in latest loss
content: The Yankees scored their first runs after 30 straight scoreless innings but still fell 3-2 to the Angels on Wednesday night for their sixth consecutive loss.

title: LSU plates three runs in 9th, makes MCWS finals
content: Down to its last out, LSU capitalized on a two-run miscue by Arkansas in the ninth inning before posting a walk-off victory to advance to the Men's College World Series finals.

title: Singer defied Dodgers, belted anthem in Spanish
content: Latin singer Nezza said that she is "super proud" of performing the national anthem in Spanish, despite being discouraged from doing so by the Dodgers, and that she has "no regrets."

title: Panthers damage Stanley Cup amid celebration
content: The Florida Panthers managed to crack and dent the Stanley Cup trophy within 24 hours of winning their second straight  championship.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone unseat the Tigers at No. 1?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit becomes the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

content: From flag football to Wrigley Field, PCA has been turning heads with his talent, energy and personality since he was a kid.

content: The group stage at the Club World Cup is well underway, and this is how every team can reach the round of 16.

content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: Trade Giannis or build around him? 8 deals the Bucks should consider
content: Milwaukee could choose to retool its roster this summer. Will the two-time MVP still be a Buck when the dust settles?

content: After taking a backseat to other NBA developmental paths, college basketball seems to be reemerging at the top.

content: With the draft a week away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Xabi says Madrid makeover 'a process' after draw
content: Xabi Alonso called for patience after Real Madrid's 1-1 draw with Al Hilal in their opening game at the Club World Cup, saying implementing the changes he wants to make "will take time."

title: Poch: USMNT not playing to get revenge on critics
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he's not seeking vengeance against his critics after a positive start for the men's national team in the 2025 Gold Cup.

title: Alba returning, Messi fit as Miami faces Porto
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said Jordi Alba and Lionel Messi will both be available for selection tomorrow in the team's second Club World Cup group stage match against FC Porto at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.

title: Mudryk faces up to 4-year ban after doping charge
content: Mykhailo Mudryk is facing a potential ban of up to four years after the Football Association charged the Chelsea winger with a doping offence.

title: Juventus net five in commanding CWC opener
content: Randal Kolo Muani and Francisco Conceição both scored twice, leading Juventus to a dominant 5-0 victory over Al Ain in their Club World Cup debut in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday night.

title: Man Utd fans fume at 'eye-watering' ticket prices
content: Manchester United fans have hit out at the club for what they say are "eye-watering" ticket increases that are a "kick in the teeth" for supporters.

title: Laporta: Barça working on 'really exciting signing'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta says the Spanish champions are working on a "really exciting signing" after completing a deal to bring in Joan García.

title: Pep laments 'unnecessary' Lewis red in City win
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola described Rico Lewis' 88th-minute red card in Wednesday's 2-0 win over Wydad AC as an "unnecessary" decision by the referee.

title: How every team can qualify for quarterfinals
content: The group stage at the Concacaf Gold Cup is well underway, and here's what every country needs to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Euro 2025 breakout stars: Which U21 players will shine?
content: Euro 2025 will offer some young players the chance to shine, and there are a number of impressive U21 stars looking to do just that.

content: Want to play in a league in which you get points for all of Travis Hunter's contributions? Here's how you do it.

title: Why this is the season to try an IDP league
content: Drafting defensive players increases the fun you can have playing fantasy. And this is the year to give it a shot.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the main event for UFC from Azerbaijan, and Ian Parker provides betting advice for UFC and PFL events this week.

title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship: From Nelly Korda to Lydia Ko's record chase, storylines to watch
content: The third major of the LPGA Tour season starts Thursday with Korda looking to get back in the winner's circle and Ko trying to add to her impressive winnings.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

content: From Aaron Judge chasing Ty Cobb(!) to the greatest season by a catcher ever, a look at some big-time big-league numbers.

content: John Henry & Co. traded another franchise icon. The only thing they can do to appease the Fenway faithful now? Win.

title: Devers and Soto on the decline? Cruz and Greene on the rise?
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a long-term look when it comes to who might be the fantasy stars to have in 2026 and beyond.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea explore move for Kudus
content: Chelsea are interested in signing West Ham midfielder Mohammed Kudus. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Why We Needn't Worry About Oil Prices Amidst Israel-Iran Conflict (For Now)
content: The unexpected attack by Israel on Iran, a major oil-producing nation, may undermine anaemic global economic growth and hinder central banks ability to cope in an already uncertain market.

title: "Extremely Dangerous": Russia Warns US Against 'Military Intervention' In Iran-Israel War
content: "We would like to particularly warn Washington against military intervention in the situation, which would be an extremely dangerous step with truly unpredictable negative consequences," Russia's foreign ministry's spokeswoman said.

title: Will Israel-Iran Conflict Impact India's Oil Reserves? What Minister Said
content: The conflict between Israel and Iran has reached an unprecedented level, with verbal threats and aerial engagement with ballistic, cruise missiles, and drones.

title: Very Bad Decision If Hezbollah Joins Iran-Israel War: US Envoy To Syria
content: A top U.S. official visiting the Lebanese capital on Thursday discouraged Tehran-backed armed group Hezbollah from intervening in the war between Iran and Israel, saying it would be a "very bad decision".

title: Donald Trump's Verbal Gaffes Under Spotlight At Hearing Meant For Biden
content: A Senate hearing to scrutinise former US President Joe Biden's mental acuity, took a 180-degree turn with Illinois Senator Dick Durbin putting Donald Trump in the spotlight.

title: How G20 Nations Could Meet The Whole World's Renewable Energy Demand
content: The member states are the G7 (the US, Japan, Germany, the UK, France, Italy, Canada), plus Australia, China, India, Indonesia, Rep

title: "Worst Call Of My Life": Delhi Man, 60, Loses 5 Family Members In Accident
content: Sixty-year-old Tanveer Ahmad was woken up from sleep by a phone call Wednesday morning. A voice did not recognise said six of his family members, including his three children, met with an accident, that their car caught fire with people still inside.

title: 40 Fighter Jets, 100 Bombs: How Israel Struck Iran, Including Key Nuclear Site
content: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) launched a series of airstrikes deep inside Iranian territory overnight on Wednesday, targeting nuclear infrastructure, missile production sites, and air defence systems.

title: Israel Kills 25 In Gaza, Including 15 Aid Seekers: Civil Defence Official
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli fire killed at least 25 people on Thursday, including 15 who had gathered near an aid distribution site.

title: 'Sowing Division': BJP After Karnataka Hikes Housing Quota For Minorities
content: The Karnataka government has increased the percentage of reservation for the downtrodden and minorities under various housing schemes from 10 to 15%, inviting a sharp reaction from the BJP, which has accused the Congress of "pushing religious quotas"

title: Iran's First Supreme Leader's Ancestors Lived In This Indian Village
content: Gripped in a bitter flareup in the Middle East crisis, the Islamic regime in Iran has vowed not to yield to US pressure and Israeli missiles.

title: Supreme Court Orders Transfer Of Kidnapping Case Against Tamil Nadu Senior Cop
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday while hearing suspended ADGP HM Jayaram directed the Tamil Nadu government to transfer the investigation of the teenager's abduction case to CB-CID.

title: Opinion: Opinion | It Is The Best Of Times, It Is The Worst Of Times, For Pakistan
content: While Pakistan has always lived by its wits, this time, it faces the unpredictable, transactionalist Donald Trump, a dealmaker with a penchant for sudden surprises (ask Zelensky).

title: 7 Dead, Over 100 Rescued Amid Heavy Rainfall In Gujarat
content: Gujarat's early monsoon showers have turned catastrophic as incessant rainfall triggered flash floods, building collapses, large-scale evacuations, and loss of life across multiple districts.

title: "You See The Pattern": Priyank Kharge On Denial Of Clearance For US Visit
content: Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge, who was not given clearance for a visit to the US, today alleged that he is being singled out for refusal and said he would question the foreign ministry about this treatment.

title: China Evacuates Hundreds Of Citizens As Iran-Israel Conflict Escalates
content: China has evacuated more than 1,600 citizens from Iran and hundreds more from Israel, a Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson said on Thursday, as evacuees clog border crossings amid the intensifying conflict between the two countries.

title: Turkey Increases Border Security As Israel-Iran Conflict Escalates
content: Turkey has increased the security of its border with Iran as the Israel-Iran conflict continues, a Turkish Defence Ministry source said on Thursday, adding Ankara had not seen any irregular migration flow from Iran.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: No Radiological Effects From Israel Strike On Iran Reactor Says UN Nuclear Watchdog
content: Moreover, Tel Aviv's residential buildings were hit by another missile. Around 40 people were wounded in the attacks, according to Israel's Magen David Adom rescue service.

title: Video: Sticks In Hand, All-Out Brawl Among Kedarnath Pilgrims
content: Viral videos on social media show violent clashes breaking out among tourists on the Kedarnath Yatra route.

title: "Let He Who Is Without Sin...": Putin, Asked About Mistakes, Quotes Bible
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin turned to the Holy Bible when asked whether he made any mistakes during his 25 years in power.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Sanjay Verma under scanner, cops probe 200+ calls with Sonam
content: The murder of businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya takes a twist with the emergence of 'Sanjay Verma,' a possible alias used by Sonam Raghuvanshi's alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. Police are investigating a potential financial motive linked to a major contract Raja secured. Reenactment of the crime revealed a second weapon and Sonam's presence during the attack.

title: 'Created to build nukes': IDF gives closer look at nuclear reactor in Iran- watch
content: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) released a video claiming Iran was using the Arak nuclear reactor to develop nuclear weapons, stating it neutralized the reactor in a recent attack. Iranian state TV confirmed the attack, noting the site was evacuated beforehand, posing no radiation threat. This action retaliated against Iran's strike on an Israeli hospital.

title: SC panel proposes impeachment of Justice Varma - What probe report said
content: A high court judge, Yashwant Varma, faces potential impeachment after an inquiry found him and his family had control over a store room where burnt cash was discovered. The inquiry committee, led by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu, found serious misconduct, leading to a recommendation for Justice Varma's removal by former CJI Sanjiv Khanna.

title: Karnataka mulls bill on crowd control post Bengaluru stampede
content: Following a tragic stampede in Bengaluru that claimed 11 lives, the Karnataka government is planning to introduce a bill focused on crowd control and management. Other proposed legislation includes the Rohith Vemula Bill, aimed at preventing caste-based discrimination, along with measures to combat misinformation, fake news, hate speech, and hate crimes.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is forcing thousands of corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle, Arlington, and Washington DC. Employees receive 30 days to decide and 60 days to relocate or resign without severance. The mandate coincides with CEO Andy Jassy's warning that AI will shrink Amazon's workforce, potentially prompting voluntary departures as a cost-cutting measure.

title: Shubman Gill plays cards close to his chest on India XI; reveals speaking to Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli
content: Shubman Gill, the new Test captain, expressed his honour at leading India and confirmed he would bat at No.4, filling Virat Kohli's spot. He emphasized creating a secure team environment and backing young players. While keeping the playing XI flexible based on pitch conditions, Gill hinted at an evolving team identity to be revealed later in the series.

title: Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy: India–England series enters new era, tribute to legends
content: In a historic move, the BCCI and ECB have announced the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy, replacing the Pataudi and Anthony De Mello Trophies, for Test series between India and England. This new title honours James Anderson and Sachin Tendulkar, celebrating their immense contributions to cricket.

title: Jeff Bezos-Sanchez wedding: Venice Mayor says ‘I am ashamed’; actions against protesters
content: Jeff Bezos's upcoming Venice wedding has sparked controversy, dividing residents. While city officials, like Mayor Luigi Brugnaro, welcome the event for its economic benefits and visibility, some locals protest, expressing resentment towards the mega-wedding. The "No Space for Bezos" collective voiced their opposition, highlighting the city's struggle to balance its historical identity with modern tourism.

title: Mid East crisis: Khamenei 'can no longer be allowed to exist,' warns Israel
content: Israel issued a stark warning to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. They said he cannot continue to exist. This followed Iranian retaliatory strikes, including an attack on an Israeli hospital. The conflict has escalated with attacks on nuclear facilities. Casualties are mounting on both sides. The US has stated it has no plans to target Khamenei for now.

title: Hospital bombed, nuclear sites hit: Iran-Israel clash spirals; Netanyahu vows to make 'tyrants' pay
content: Amidst escalating conflict, Iran and Israel exchanged missile strikes, targeting critical infrastructure. US President Trump weighs military action, hinting at potential talks. Operation Sindhu evacuated 110 Indian nationals from Iran. Reports indicate significant casualties in Iran. Russia offers to mediate, while Iran's leader vows no surrender, signaling a complex and volatile situation in the Middle East.

title: Will AI take IT jobs in India? Narayana Murthy opens up: What will happen in the future is our programmers will …
content: nfosys founder NR Narayana Murthy dismisses AI job elimination fears, arguing technology creates new employment opportunities. Citing banking sector's 40-50x job growth post-computerization, he believes AI will enhance productivity and enable programmers to solve complex problems, transforming rather than replacing the workforce in India's IT industry.

title: 'Have disagreements with some in Congress leadership,' admits Shashi Tharoor
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has acknowledged his differences with the party's leadership, revealing he wasn't invited to campaign in the Nilambur Assembly byelection. Tharoor emphasized resolving issues internally and reaffirmed his commitment to the party's values and workers.

title: Stokes on India Tests: 'No Virat, Rohit or Ashwin, but that doesn't make it easier'
content: England captain Ben Stokes acknowledges the absence of key Indian players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for the upcoming Test series but warns against underestimating India's new squad under Shubman Gill. Stokes praises Jasprit Bumrah and welcomes Chris Woakes' return, highlighting England's strong record with him.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: On call, Putin, Xi term West Asia 'top priority'; condemn Israeli strikes
content: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have strongly condemned Israeli strikes on Iran, urging de-escalation through diplomacy. They emphasized that halting hostilities is the top priority, as the conflict intensifies with attacks on both sides, including a missile strike on an Israeli hospital and retaliatory strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. The situation threatens to escalate into a broader regional war.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Primed to take ...' - Kirsten's bold prediction about captain Gill
content: Gary Kirsten expresses confidence in Shubman Gill's leadership abilities as he embarks on his first full Test captaincy assignment against England. Kirsten highlights Gill's intelligence, dedication, and exemplary training habits as key factors for success. Matthew Hayden acknowledges Gill's potential while noting his limited Test experience in England.

title: 'Hope the food was good': Tharoor's jab at Trump's lunch with Pakistan's Munir
content: Shashi Tharoor criticized Donald Trump's lunch with Asim Munir. He reminded the US of Pakistan's history with terrorism. Tharoor cited Osama bin Laden's presence near a Pakistani army camp. He hoped the US raised concerns about Pakistan's support for terrorism. Trump invited Narendra Modi to the US, but Modi declined.

title: UGC NET June 2025: City intimation slip delayed, check ugcnet.nta.ac.in for updates
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has delayed the release of the city intimation slip for the UGC NET June 2025 exam, originally expected by June 16. With exams starting on June 25, candidates remain uncertain about their exam centre locations. The admit card will follow soon after the city slip. Aspirants are advised to regularly check the official website, ugcnet.nta.ac.in, for updates and prepare accordingly for the examination.

title: Can gaining even 3-4 kgs of weight increase risk of kidney disease? How to prevent it
content: Even modest weight gain, not just obesity, can strain the kidneys, leading to hyperfiltration and potential damage. Kidneys don’t complain. They don’t show fatigue, or ache, or make noise. That’s why even small signals—like a few extra kilos—need attention. In today’s world, where lifestyle diseases often begin quietly, guarding kidney health becomes more about awareness than alarm.

title: MLC: 'Cricket in USA is a sleeping giant' - Mott eyes long-term success with Seattle
content: Matthew Mott, now coaching Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket, shares his vision for growing cricket in the US. He emphasises building a team-first culture, nurturing local talent alongside international stars, and providing better infrastructure for player development. Mott believes MLC can inspire young Americans and create a sustainable cricket ecosystem, ultimately feeding into the national team.

title: Air India crash: Chandra says 787 had ‘new engine’, ‘clean history’ & ‘no red flags’
content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran expressed grief over the Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, which resulted in over 270 fatalities. He announced the creation of an "AI-171 Trust" to provide long-term support to affected families. Investigations into the cause of the crash are underway, with preliminary findings expected in a month, while Air India is cooperating fully with authorities.

title: Who is 'Jeff'? And why does 'he' have 10 nuclear weapons?
content: Every time the world inches closer to nuclear war, a question echoes across newsroom Slack threads, Reddit conspiracies, and cable news chyron typos: Who the hell is Jeff?

title: Sealed over ice cream & walk! How India-UK trade deal was finalised, Piyush Goyal reveals
content: India and the UK finalized their Free Trade Agreement (FTA) during an informal meeting in London's Hyde Park, where Minister Piyush Goyal and his UK counterpart, Jonathan Reynolds, sealed the deal over ice cream.

title: Travis Kelce shares cozy home moments with Taylor Swift
content: Travis Kelce shared a glimpse into his relationship with Taylor Swift, revealing they have a shared movie list, including 'Pretty Woman.' This detail highlights their low-key moments amidst fame. Kelce's past movie experiences, like watching 'American Pie,' also connect to Swift's song lyrics, showcasing their grounded connection.

title: Sun emits year's strongest solar flare, triggers radio blackouts: Nasa
content: NASA reports sunspot region 4114 unleashed 2025's most powerful X1.2-class solar flare on June 17, causing widespread shortwave radio blackouts, especially over the Pacific, including Hawaii. Frequencies below 25 MHz were disrupted, affecting aviators and ham radio operators. Although no coronal mass ejection accompanied it, the flare's intensity disturbed Earth's ionosphere.

title: IPL 2025 breaks viewership records as final becomes most-watched T20 match ever, BARC data reveals
content: JioStar's broadcast of IPL 2025 reached over a billion viewers, amassing 840 billion minutes of watch-time. The RCB vs PBKS final became the most-watched T20 match ever, with 31.7 billion minutes consumed. Digital consumption surged by 29%, while linear TV also achieved record-breaking viewership, marking a monumental success for the tournament.

title: Who is Divya? Indian star congratulated by PM Modi after win over world no. 1 Yifan
content: Divya Deshmukh, an 18-year-old Indian chess prodigy, has gained global recognition after defeating World No. 1 Hou Yifan at the World Blitz Team Chess Championship in London. Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded her victory, highlighting her determination and inspiration to aspiring chess players. Divya's success, along with her other achievements, underscores India's growing prominence in international chess.

title: 'Plan B' if 'Plan A' fails: Bengaluru airport gets bomb threat
content: Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru faced a security scare. An email threatened bombs on the premises. Authorities conducted extensive checks following the threat. No explosives were discovered, and the threat was declared a hoax. Police have started an investigation to find the email's sender. Airport operations were not significantly disrupted during the security procedures. The case has been registered.

title: 'You succumbed to pressure': SC raps Karnataka govt over threat to 'Thug Life' release
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Karnataka government to ensure the smooth screening of Kamal Haasan's film "Thug Life," taking action against those obstructing its release. The court expressed concern over the suppression of artistic expression due to perceived offense, emphasizing the state's duty to protect freedom of expression.

title: IND vs ENG: 'No Virat, no Rohit —It feels strange'; KL Rahul on a new era in Indian cricket
content: KL Rahul acknowledges the absence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the upcoming Test series against England, highlighting the opportunity for younger players to step up. He praised Karun Nair's comeback after eight years, recognizing his resilience and recent form.

title: 'Saw missile fall from sky': Evacuated Indian students share Iran ordeal
content: In the wake of Operation Sindhu, Indian students returning from Iran shared their chilling accounts of survival amidst missile strikes and destruction. One student vividly recalled the sight of missiles raining down, leaving Tehran in devastation. The Indian government stepped in, offering comprehensive support for their safe return, including personalized assistance.

title: 'Turning humans into machines': 12-hour shifts for Bengaluru techies?
content: The Karnataka State IT/ITeS Employees Union (KITU) is urging workers to oppose the Karnataka government's proposal to extend daily working hours in the IT, ITeS, and BPO sectors to 12 hours. Trade unions have voiced strong opposition, citing concerns about work-life balance, job security, and potential mental health impacts, viewing the move as prioritizing corporate profits over employee welfare.

title: Paris DL: Will Neeraj Chopra be up against Pakistan's Nadeem? All you need to know
content: Neeraj Chopra will compete at the Paris Diamond League 2025 without facing his Pakistani rival Arshad Nadeem. Chopra returns to the French capital after eight years, aiming for victory after recent second-place finishes. The event boasts a star-studded lineup including Julian Weber and Anderson Peters. Following Paris, Chopra will participate in Ostrava's Golden Spike meet and his hosted Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru.

title: IND vs ENG: How England’s Test pitches have become batting-friendly yet result-oriented
content: England's Test pitches have transformed over the past five years. Once known for seam and swing, they now offer flatter decks, higher scoring, and more results. Run rates are up, draws are down, and Bazball has redefined tempo. With fewer grind-fests and more fourth-innings drama, Test cricket in England feels faster, fresher, and far more entertaining.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant eyes Dhoni's massive record; Leeds Test to start on June 20
content: Rishabh Pant eyes MS Dhoni's record as Pant seeks to become India's top wicketkeeper-batter. He needs one more century to surpass Dhoni's Test record. The upcoming England series is crucial for Pant. Dhruv Jurel's performance adds pressure. Pant aims to improve after a below-par showing in Australia. All eyes are on Pant's performance in the upcoming matches.

title: Footage shows moment Iranian missile struck Israel's main hospital in south
content: A dramatic escalation in tensions has occurred as an Iranian missile has struck the Soroka Hospital in southern Israel, inflicting serious damage. Emergency services are on the scene assessing the casualties, and residents are strongly advised to avoid the area.

title: Air India plane crash: Black box of 787 Dreamliner to be sent to US for data recovery
content: India will send the severely damaged black box from the Air India Boeing 787 crash to the United States for detailed analysis. Data extraction in India has proven unfeasible due to extensive fire damage. The National Safety Transport Board in Washington will examine the Digital Flight Data Recorder.

title: Sunjay Kapur funeral: Karisma Kapoor accompanies kids for their father's last rites
content: Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's funeral will be held in New Delhi on Thursday, with ex-wife Karisma Kapoor and their children, Samaira and Kiaan, attending. They were seen at the Mumbai airport, accompanied by Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan, heading to the ceremony.

title: IND vs ENG: Projected India XI for first Test; series begins on June 20
content: Shubman Gill captains a new-look Indian team in England, aiming to end an 18-year Test series drought, stepping in after Kohli and Sharma's retirements. Gill also replaces Kohli at No. 4, facing pressure to perform despite a modest Test record in England. There are question marks elsewhere - such as for the No. 3 spot and on the bowling lineup.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Karma is unforgiving' - Mukesh shares cryptic post after Harshit gets India call-up
content: India's Test squad sees a late change as Harshit Rana joins the team for the England series, following his India-A performance. This decision has sparked debate, especially after Mukesh Kumar's cryptic social media post and criticism from Dodda Ganesh, who suggested Anshul Kamboj's inclusion.

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: NFL execs, scouts pick their favorite offseason moves: Where Rodgers, Pickens rate
content: twenty-eight teams are officially off for the summer, with the frenzied nature of transactions fading into the background . this week's minicamp is the ideal time to take stock of the splash moves around the league . a few potential moves remain on the radar, including a potential Jalen Ramsey trade .

title: Why one Hall of Fame sidekick sees a lot of himself in OKC's Jalen Williams
content: HE WAS A no-star recruit coming out of high school, landing at a small college before a sudden growth spurt . he didn't register on scouts' radars until a couple of years later . this once unheralded prospect just kept getting better after arriving in the NBA .

title: How the Thunder win it all and the Pacers force Game 7
content: Shams Charania and Brian Windhorst break down what Tyrese Haliburton could mean for the Pacers heading into game 6 . the 2025 finals are one step closer to crowning a new champion . a strained right calf and will undergo an MRI .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: 16 nations will compete at euro 2025 in Switzerland for the chance to be crowned european champions . the stakes are higher than ever, with prize money more than doubled compared with the previous tournament . each federation receives at least €1.8 million and required to allocate at least 30% to players .

title: Trump approves Iran strike plans but no final order yet; what's the attack plan?
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Recruiting intel from Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
content: 20 of the nation's top high school quarterbacks convened in Southern California for the Elite 11 Finals . from Tuesday night to Thursday morning, 20 headliners convene in southern California . among the headliners are five-star passers in the 2026 ESPN 300 . a final round of official visits before the recruiting dead period from June 23 to July 31 .

title: New rules for US student visa: Social media profiles must be 'public'
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs .

title: Why the Panthers are the nicest 'rats' to win the Stanley Cup (twice)
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: 🏈 College football's 10 most unbreakable records
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Assam's maternal mortality ratio improved significantly in last 20 years: Himanta
content: Assam is no longer the highest MMR State in the country. Assam’s MMR is now better than Madhya Pradesh (159), Chhattisgarh (141), Uttar Pradesh (141) and Odisha (136) as per SRS 2020-22, says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Change in Manipur admin inevitable, popular govt should be formed: Assembly speaker
content: “I heard that groups are being constituted for the formation of a government. I also heard someone from Delhi will be deputed for the government formation”, Thokchom Satyabrata Singh said.

title: Telangana CM and Irrigation Minister seek Centre’s intervention in stalling Godavari-Banakacharla project works by Andhra Pradesh
content: TG will approach Supreme Court if the Centre did not respond to the State’s request, they tell Union Jal Shakti Minister

title: An alumnus-led trust pools money, donates new bus to govt. school at Thirumangalakottai Keelaiyur
content: The bus is expected to require at least ₹40,000 a month as running expenses (including staff salaries) and the trust, headed by retired general surgeon and alumnus of school Dr. M. Selvaraj, is confident of creating a corpus to keep it going

title: T.N. govt. school student clears JEE Advanced, gets into IIT-Madras with coaching at NIT-Tiruchi’s IGNITTE
content: The student of Arignar Anna Government Higher Secondary School at Pachaperumalpatti village, Thuraiyur, had secured seat in NIT Silchar after clearing JEE Mains 2024 with 91.23 percentile

title: IIT-Madras is now among top 200 varsities in QS global rankings, Anna University slips
content: While IIT Madras is ranked 180th, Anna University that is ranked 10th among Indian universities, saw its global ranking fall from 383rd to 465th position.

title: Chandrasekaran skips TCS annual general meeting amid Air India crisis
content: TCS' Company Secretary Yashaswin Sheth informed shareholders of TCS that Chairman Chandrasekaran will not be able to attend the Annual General Meeting (AGM) due to "some exigencies"

title: Sambhal violence: Chargesheet details MP's conversation with Jama Masjid president, says police
content: MP Zia-ur-Rahman Barq has been charged in this case...They were responsible for gathering the crowd on November 22, two days prior to the widespread violence, says SP Vishnoi

title: PVR INOX multiplex at Chennai airport’s Aerohub faces closure due to legal dispute
content: Madras High Court directs Airports Authority of India to maintain status quo until it could consider the multiplex chain’s request to not disturb its operations

title: A.P. Police agree to handover mortal remains of three top Maoists gunned down in exchange of fire to their family members
content: The bodies will be handed over to the respective families in a respectful manner and the police would provide logistics for transportation of the mortal remains, says DSP G. Sai Prasanth

title: Centre’s stand on Keeladi report an onslaught on Tamil culture: T.N. CM Stalin
content: The Chief Minister said in a letter to party workers that it is “a blatant attack by the BJP government on Tamil culture and pride”

title: ‘Those who speak English in India will soon feel ashamed’: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said that “our culture, our history, and our religion cannot be understood in foreign languages”

title: Drone surveillance begins around Hyderabad schools to focus on student safety; CCTV cameras in all school vehicles suggested
content: If any incident involving a student occurs within 200 metres of a school campus, the institution’s management will be held responsible: Hyderabad police commissioner CV Anand

title: Bharat Mata row: Kerala Minister walks out of event, Raj Bhavan calls it ‘grave insult’ to Governor
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar says there is ‘no question of doing away with Bharat Mata’

title: Anti-rape laws: How many States have passed them and have they been implemented?
content: Since the 2012 Delhi gangrape case, the Parliament has amended laws thrice and eight States have passed legislation making punishment for rape more stringent.

title: Shashi Tharoor says he has ‘differences of opinion’ with some in Congress leadership
content: Tharoor says ‘Congress, its values, and its workers were very dear to him’ and that he has worked closely with the party workers for 16 years and sees them ‘close friends and brothers’

title: ‘Thug Life’ release in Karnataka: Unending ‘litany of hurt sentiments’ cannot choke free speech in films, says Supreme Court
content: Justice Manmohan shared the exasperation on the Bench, saying “Should everything be stopped… movies, theatre, nobody can recite a poem?”

title: Chefs in community kitchens of Dakshina Kannada district in Karnataka exposed to high levels of particulate matter, says collaborative study
content: Study on air pollution in 15 community kitchens in DK was done by Mangalore University, IIT Bombay and University of Miami

title: Cash discovery row: Piles of currency notes found in Justice Varma’s gutted storeroom, says inquiry committee report
content: The report reveals that the currency notes are “highly suspicious items, not of small value” and could not have been placed in the storeroom without the consent of Justice Varma or his family

title: Huge blow to Indian diplomacy: Congress on Trump-Munir lunch
content: Field Marshal Asim Munir is not the Head of State or Head of government of Pakistan and is the Chief of Army Staff, yet he gets invited by Mr. Trump, and receives praise, Congress says

title: From transfers to training, Man City are taking Club World Cup seriously
content: man city boss pep Guardiola says he has "closed a chapter" in the club world cup . the last remaining piece of silverware was safely tucked away in the trophy cabinet . it's been 18 months since Guardiola's emotional speech in jeddah .

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 4: Who's the new No. 1?
content: four teams are 2-1, while the other four are 1-2 . the redwoods jump into a top spot after a 12-11 win over California last week . they have the no. 1 scoring defense in the PLL, but they are winning just 38% of their faceoffs .

title: One Church, One Mass movement members lay siege to Syro-Malabar Church headquarters in Kerala
content: Protestors seek resignation of Major Archbishop Mar Raphael Thattil and Vicar of the Archbishop Mar Joseph Pamplany

title: Firing outside RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav’s residence in Patna
content: The incident took place ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Bihar on June 20, where he is scheduled to address a public meeting in Siwan district

title: ‘Continuous finance’ model involving fake policy for vehicles deprives Telangana woman of insurance money
content: A fatal road crash has exposed how the murky ‘continuous finance’ model is fuelling fake vehicle insurance in rural Telangana

title: A week on, 211 Air India plane crash victims identified via DNA tests; 189 bodies handed over to kin
content: The DNA tests are being carried out to establish the identity of the victims as many bodies were charred beyond recognition or severely damaged

title: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Lokesh meets Tony Blair, seeks support in implementing education reforms
content: Mr. Blair and Mr. Lokesh took stock of the progress made by the A.P. Government on those fronts, and discussed collaboration in areas like skill development and skill census among others issues.

title: ‘Police deny permission to see Maoist Aruna’s mortal remains,’ says her sister Jhansi
content: Speaking to The Hindu, Ms. Jhansi said: “We have rushed to the hospital at 5 a. m. and police did not allow us to see the mortal remains of our sister to confirm her identity”

title: Hyderabad-based Raghu Vamsi showcases 40 KGF micro turbojet engine, kamikaze drones at Paris Air Show
content: The group acquires U.S. aerospace firm WMT Precision LLC for $8.5 million that counts Collins, Parker and Honeywell among customers

title: History-sheeter shot by police in Tamil Nadu’s Karur district
content: A day earlier, the accused shot and three of his associates were booked for an attempt to murder a man during quarrel

title: Held forward-looking discussion with Jammu & Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah on tourism development: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat
content: “Emphasis was laid on enhancing infrastructure, promoting heritage sites, and creating sustainable livelihood opportunities for local communities through tourism,” Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said in his post

title: Tamil Nadu ADGP suspension case: Supreme Court transfers investigation to CB-CID, sets aside Madras HC order
content: Supreme Court also requested the Madras High Court chief justice to transfer cases involving the ADGP to another bench.

title: Funding, infrastructure, general environment woes unattractive for senior international scientists to work in India: Nobel laureate Venki Ramakrishnan
content: India has only a handful of institutions such as IISc, NCBS, TIFR, IISERs and IITs that can possibly attract U.S. scientists, and even they are “world class only in some very specific areas”, he says

title: ED raids in Bihar constable recruitment 'scam' linked PMLA case
content: At least a dozen locations in Patna and Nalanda in Bihar, Ranchi (Jharkhand), Lucknow (Uttar Pradesh) and Kolkata (West Bengal) are being covered under PMLA

title: One more arrested for ‘pro-Pakistan’ post in Assam, total 94 since Pahalgam terror attack
content: Mr. Sarma had earlier said the ‘State-wide crackdown on traitors would continue and nobody would be spared’.

title: Nilambur bypoll: P.V. Anvar kicks up fresh row by refusing to embrace UDF candidate Shoukath on poll day
content: Aryadan Shoukath walked up to Anvar and shook hands with him when they met at a polling station. However, Anvar warned Shoukath not to embrace him. ‘Because I feared it will be a Dhritarashtra embrace’, he said later

title: ‘True crusader for justice’: Rahul Gandhi turns 55, wishes pour in from Congress leaders, PM Modi
content: Birthday wishes for Rahul Gandhi on his 55th birthday praised his dedication to Constitution’s values and compassion for unheard voices

title: Leh-bound IndiGo plane returns to Delhi due to technical issue
content: According IndiGo spokespeson, the aircraft is undergoing necessary maintenance before resuming operations.

title: Smoked briskets are slowly making it big in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The American beef brisket is a new addition to Thiruvananthapuram’s food scene among other continental flavours in the city

title: Five-year-old battles rabies in Kerala’s Kannur; jackal attack adds to scare
content: The boy sustained bites on eye and leg. Though he was vaccinated immediately, doctors said facial wounds allowed virus to reach brain

title: Prayoga and SBI Foundation join hands to transform science education for primary school students in Raichur
content: The collaboration is part of SBIF’s Integrated Learning Mission (ILM) titled Reimagining Science Education

title: Hope PM will finally agree to debate on China during Parliament’s Monsoon session: Congress
content: The Opposition party also said it is important to collectively work towards a national consensus on vital national security and economic challenges posed by China’s emergence

title: Nilambur bypoll in Kerala: Polling progresses on a brisk note
content: Many voters reached the polling stations well before polling started at 7 a.m. Polling will continue until 6 p.m.

title: Air India plane crash: Body of co-pilot Clive Kunder brought home
content: The ill-fated flight was under the command of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal along with First Officer Clive Kunder

title: HDFC Bank CEO moves Bombay High Court over FIR by Lilavati Trust
content: The matter will now be reassigned to a new Bench by an administrative order of the Chief Justice and will be heard in due course of time

title: Liquor Scam: SIT police produce former MLA Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy in court, remanded
content: Police took Mr. Bhaskar Reddy into custody on Tuesday, and shifted him to Vijayawada. Investigation officers named Bhaskar Reddy as Accused No.38 in the case.

title: Students evacuated from Iran to be brought back in deluxe buses: J&K CM
content: As many as 90 students from Jammu and Kashmir were among the 110 people evacuated from war-affected Iran

title: Row over Hindi: Marathi literary body opposes three-language formula
content: The Mahamandal also questioned the need to teach a third language when many schools do not have enough teachers, and students of higher classes struggle to read Marathi books of Class 2 level

title: Despite Supreme Court backing, ‘Thug Life’ release doubtful in Karnataka
content: Kamal Haasan’s ‘Thug Life’ faces rejection from Karnataka distributors due to its poor box office performance across the country

title: PM to flag off first indigenous locomotive for export to Guinea on June 20 in Bihar
content: The Marhowrah facility will supply 150 locomotives worth more than ₹3,000 crore for the iron ore project in Guinea

title: 'Despicable': Allahabad High Court slams family's objection to woman marrying person of choice
content: “The fact that there is social and familial resistance to the exercise of such right is a glaring depiction of the ‘value gap’ between the constitutional norms and those social”

title: Without addressing inequalities, no nation can claim to be truly democratic: CJI Gavai
content: The CJI said that it is not merely a matter of redistribution or welfare but it is also about enabling every person to live with dignity, to realise their full human potential, and to participate as equals

title: Assembly bypolls 2025 LIVE: More than 41% turnout in Ludhiana West; close to 60% in Nilambur till 3 p.m.
content: The byelections are being held in two Assembly constituencies in Gujarat and one each in Kerala, West Bengal and Punjab

title: PM Modi concludes visit to Croatia after meeting top leadership
content: Mr. Modi held delegation-level talks with Plenković and met President Zoran Milanovic to discuss a range of issues to boost bilateral ties.

title: Yoga Day preparations lead to traffic congestion in Vizag
content: Entry of vehicles from Jodugullapalem to RK Beach restricted; DSC candidates advised to start early for the exam today

title: Suresh Chandra Menon: Tamil actor dons new avatar as traffic solutions man in Chennai
content: Meet ‘traffic solutions’ Suresh: How this Tamil film personality is changing the face of Chennai’s OMR

title: Flight carrying 110 Indian students, evacuated from war-torn Iran under Operation Sindhu; lands in Delhi
content: At the Indira Gandhi Airport, New Delhi, families of students from the north Indian states queued up to welcome their children, while officials from the southern states and that of J&K waited to escort them to their home states

title: Heavy rains: Outflow from Kabini reservoir increased, Hemavati dam shutters to be opened
content: Increased outflow from Kabini reservoir prompts flood warning in Karnataka; residents urged to move to higher ground for safety

title: Tata Group chairman N. Chandrasekaran 'apologises' for Ahmedabad Air India plane crash
content: Mr. Chandrasekaran acknowledged Air India needs to do a better job of communicating with passengers about these matters

title: MP expresses concern about ‘tardy progress’ of Ernakulam Junction redevelopment work
content: Mr. Eden sought steps to build a foot overbridge linking the Thripunithura railway and metro stations.

title: Preferential treatment raises eyebrows
content: Preferential treatment for the mighty would undermine the foundation of the rule of law and public trust in the system

title: Chennai Metro Rail slaps ₹1 crore fine on contractor, removes four staff after Ramapuram girder crash
content: According to officials, following an inquiry, four persons who were directly responsible for the incident have been removed from the project.

title: CTH Road needs to be widened to boost Thiruninravur’s development, say residents
content: The suburb lacks major hospitals, hotels and parking spaces; there aren’t enough bus and rail services to this thickly populated area, say residents; they demand better connectivity to places such as Kilambakkam, Tirupati and Tiruvallur

title: Warangal students win $5,000 in prestigious Generative AI Hackathon
content: Their project, Content Hub, stood out for its innovative approach to AI-driven social media engagement

title: TGCSB and NALSAR sign pact to strengthen cyber law enforcement in Telangana
content: The collaboration seeks to merge legal education, policy research and forensic capabilities with the TGCSB’s operational expertise, creating a multidisciplinary framework to tackle cybercrime

title: Kerala High Court says govt cannot insist toilets in petroleum retail outlets be opened for public
content: Order came on a petition filed by the Petroleum Traders Welfare and Legal Service Society and five retailers challenging the move of  the government and local bodies to convert these toilets as public toilets.

title: BSNL building AI system to identify and correct defects in services: CMD
content: Multinational companies took years to stabilise, said Ravi, and insisted that the BSNL 4G speeds are much better than that of its competitors

title: Teachers protest after dead lizards were found in snack at Madras varsity
content: The incident happened at the Guindy campus of the university; the dead lizards were found in sundal that was offered to the teachers as a mid-morning snack
